required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Reduced GCSF Dosing in Patients With a Low to Moderate Risk of Febrile Neutropenia
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Randomized Study to Verify the Papaldo's Hypothesis : the Effectiveness of a Reduced Dosing of G-CSF in Chemotherapy-treated Patients With a Low to Moderate Risk of Febrile Neutropenia

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to confirm that a reduced dosage of GCSF is effective in preventing febrile neutropenia among patients with breast cancer, treated with chemotherapy and presenting with a low to moderate risk of developing febrile neutropenia.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of a febrile neutropenic episode defined as fever (>=38.5°C once or >=38°C twice within 12 hours interval) and neutropenia (ANC < 0.5 IU)
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning of 2nd chemotherapy cycle, no more than 30 days after randomization

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning of second chemotherapy cycle, no more than 30 days after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: Unplanned hospitalization is defined as the need to admit a patient outside of the schedule that was planned for chemotherapy administration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning of the second chemotherapy cycle, no more than 30 days after randomization
secondary_outcome.description: A complicated febrile neutropenic episode is defined as a febrile neutropenic episode (see above) that does not resolve without the occurrence of serious medical complication as defined in Klasterky J et al; JCO 2000 : 3038-3051

arm_group.description: Prophylactic administration of GCSF on days 8 and 12 following chemotherapy

intervention.intervention_name: GCSF administration on days 8 and 12 after chemotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Breast cancer Chemotherapy administration (new line) Chemotherapy type : FEC, EC, AC, docetaxel containing regimen Chemotherapy setting : adjuvant or neoadjuvant
Exclusion Criteria:
Eligibility to receive reimbursed GCSF
